channel.title: How to compare grades in different countrys?
channel.description:
Well, ill explain what i mean
Here, we have the grades from 1 to 10 However, the grades in america ( A B C D F ) wich is in total 5, and is half of ours
Soo, what im thinking is, a F, would be worth 2 ? Because 10/5=2 D=4, C=6 etc.
This is basicly something that confuses me

item.title: How to compare grades in different countrys?
item.dc:creator: @Coolnoob55 Coolnoob55
item.description:
@Coolnoob55 wrote:

Priv School in US:
A=100-92
B=91-83
C=83-78
D= 78-70
F= 70>

item.title: How to compare grades in different countrys?
item.dc:creator: @Starblaster100 Starblaster100
item.description:
@Starblaster100 wrote:

England:
90+ = A*
80+ = A
70+ = B
60+ = C
50+ = D
40+ = E
<40 = F / U

All % obviously

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

In Colorado, US it is:

90-100 = A
80-89 = B
70-79 = C
60-69 = D
59- = F

item.title: How to compare grades in different countrys?
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

In Finland the grades are from 4(the worst)-to 10(the best). My average on my report card was 8.3… last year it was 8.5…

Read full topic
item.source: How to compare grades in different countrys?

item.title: How to compare grades in different countrys?
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“booduh, post:6, topic:3941”]Woah, Canada’s grading system is super laid back…

America’s is…
A(100-93%)
B(92-85%)
C(84-77%)
D(76-70%)
F(69-0%)[/quote]

Where the hell do you live?

Ours is
A(100-90%)
B(89-80%)
C(79-73%)
D(73-70%)
F(69-0%)
And I’m in Georgia.

Read full topic
item.source: How to compare grades in different countrys?

item.title: How to compare grades in different countrys?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

[quote=“Gravey, post:8, topic:3941”][quote author=jme_009 link=topic=4896.msg49638#msg49638 date=1150603454]
An F is a 69 percent? Wouldnt it be like under 50%?

In Canada or at my school, we just use percentegs and 4 lvl’s.

lvl1 = D(50-59%), lvl2=C(60-69%), lvl3= B(70-79%), lvl4 = A(80-100%)
[/quote]
Where 'bouts do you live? Cause I live in BC and for me it’s:
49 or less = F
50-60 = C-
60-65 = C
65-72 = C+
72-85 = B
86+ = A[/quote]

Ontario, in the renfrew county.

The way canada works is much different in every province. Even the drinking age etc is different. Newfoundland you need to be 21, Ontario 19, quebec 18, etc…

Read full topic
item.source: How to compare grades in different countrys?
